release.change: New: Android Nougat support. Please grant WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission via ADB if you are not rooted.
New: QuickTile support on Nougat. You can now add a ForceDoze tile to your Quick Settings to quickly toggle ForceDoze on or off. Long pressing the tile will open ForceDoze.
New: App Shortcuts support on Nougat 7.1+. You can press and hold the ForceDoze icon on your homescreen to access shortcuts to Settings and Battery stats.
New: Doze Tunables support so you can modify Doze parameters directly. (requires root to apply changes directly)
New: Block notifications support. You can disable notifications for apps during Doze so they don't drain battery. Requires root.
New: Block apps support. You can disable apps (and its background services) during Doze mode so they don't drain your battery. Requires root.
New: Privacy policy. You can view it in Settings About ForceDoze - Privacy policy
Changed: You can access the 'Debug logs' option in Settings without root. You will have to grant READ_LOGS permission via ADB.
Fixed: A bug that could cause ForceDozeService to not reliably enter or exit Doze mode.
Fixed: Crash when clicking on Donate option.

Fixed: ForceDoze not adding itself to Doze whitelist on Nougat. Now, it will show you a notification that will take you to the battery optimisation settings to manually add ForceDoze, as it's not possible to add it automatically by ForceDoze on Nougat.

Fixed: ForceDoze calling deviceidle to add itself to whitelist, causing an exception because DEVICE_POWER permission wasn't granted. The permission cannot be granted to apps like ForceDoze, hence a workaround has been implemented as described above.
Fixed: Whitelist not loading packages properly or showing white screen.
Fixed: Doze stats scrolling down automatically when you open it.
Fixed: Crash on certain devices if they turn on Auto-rotate/brightness fix.
